Problem_Size    	Setting_UP(s) 	Memory_Allocation(s)    	Copy_Data_H2D(s)    	Kernel(s)    	Copy_Data_D2H(s)
10x10		0.000015		0.863038			0.000040			0.000042		0.000022
100x100		0.000242		0.831370			0.000045			0.000040		0.000056
1000x1000	0.019548		0.826722			0.001083			0.000179		0.001302
1250x1250	0.030632		0.815527			0.001650			0.000257		0.001465
3000x3000	0.131222		0.853168			0.008576			0.001296		0.009379
6000x6000	0.478392		0.767316			0.030374			0.004884		0.031006
10000x10000	1.062235		0.759831			0.082010			0.013493		0.085209
15000x15000	2.180123		0.756216			0.178724			0.025608		0.190500
25000x25000	5.770220		0.830165			0.496241			0.041168		0.527467
40000x40000	14.494886	0.772154			1.294814			0.122731		1.354336


1.	
Problem_Size		Kernel(s)		FLOPS
10x10			0.000042			119047619
100x100			0.000040			12500000000
1000x1000		0.000179			279329608900
1250x1250		0.000257			303988326800
3000x3000		0.001296			347222222222
6000x6000		0.004884			368550368600
10000x10000		0.013493			370562513900
15000x15000		0.025608			439315838800
25000x25000		0.041168			759084726000
40000x40000		0.122731			651832055500

I chose inputs that reflected magnitude greater increases in size and more nuanced smaller increases to look at both types of input changes. The FLOPS ranged from 119047619 to 651832055500.The floating point operations per second seemed to increase as the size of images also increased, that is for the GPU side.


2.
Problem_Size		Total_Time(s)		Overhead(s)		Overhead(%)
10x10			0.863142			0.8631			99.99%
100x100			0.831511			0.831471			99.99%
1000x1000		0.829286			0.829107			99.99%
1250x1250		0.818899			0.818642			99.99%
3000x3000		0.872419			0.871123			99.85%
6000x6000		0.83358			0.828696			99.41%
10000x10000		0.940543			0.92705			98.57%
15000x15000		1.151048			1.12544			97.77%
25000x25000		1.895041			1.853873			97.83%
40000x40000		3.544035			3.421304			96.54%

The percentage overhead time ranged from 99.99% to 96.54%. The overhead time increased as the image size went up but that was mostly counteracted by the increase in time from copying memory on the CPU. Overall the overhead percent decreases as the image size increased.
